verses.kjv: Then came the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, into the desert of Zin in the first month: and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there.
verses.ct: The entire Israelite community arrived in the desert of Zin during the 1st month. The people stayed in Kadesh, and Miriam died and was buried there.

verses.kjv: And there was no water for the congregation: and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
verses.ct: There was no water for the community, so they gathered together to confront Moses and Aaron.

verses.kjv: And the people chode with Moses, and spake, saying, Would God that we had died when our brethren died before the LORD!
verses.ct: The people argued with Moses and said, "We wish we had died when our brothers died in the LORD's presence!"

verses.kjv: And why have ye brought up the congregation of the LORD into this wilderness, that we and our cattle should die there?
verses.ct: "Why did you bring the LORD's community into this wilderness for us and our livestock to die here?"

verses.kjv: And wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in unto this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.
verses.ct: "Why did you take us out of Egypt just to bring us to this terrible place? Nothing grows here — no grain, no figs, no grapes, no pomegranates — and there isn't even water to drink!"

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they fell upon their faces: and the glory of the LORD appeared unto them.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron left the crowd and went to the entrance of the tent of meeting, where they fell facedown. Then the glory of the LORD appeared to them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses:

verses.kjv: Take the rod, and gather thou the assembly together, thou, and Aaron thy brother, and speak ye unto the rock before their eyes; and it shall give forth his water, and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock: so thou shalt give the congregation and their beasts drink.
verses.ct: "Take the staff and assemble the community — you and your brother Aaron. Speak to the rock right in front of them, and it will pour out its water. You will bring water out of the rock for them, so the community and their animals can drink."

verses.kjv: And Moses took the rod from before the LORD, as he commanded him.
verses.ct: Moses took the staff from the LORD's presence, just as he had been commanded.

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron gathered the congregation together before the rock, and he said unto them, Hear now, ye rebels; must we fetch you water out of this rock?
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron assembled the community in front of the rock, and Moses said to them, "Listen up, you rebels! Do we have to produce water for you from this rock?"

verses.kjv: And Moses lifted up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice: and the water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their beasts also.
verses.ct: Then Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his staff. Water gushed out in abundance, and the community and their animals drank.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them.
verses.ct: But the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, "Because you did not trust me enough to honor me as holy before the Israelites, you will not lead this community into the land I have given them."

verses.kjv: This is the water of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with the LORD, and he was sanctified in them.
verses.ct: These were the waters of Meribah, where the Israelites quarreled with the LORD, and where he demonstrated his holiness among them.

verses.kjv: And Moses sent messengers from Kadesh unto the king of Edom, Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou knowest all the travail that hath befallen us:
verses.ct: Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom with this message: "Your brother Israel says: You know about all the hardships we have endured.

verses.kjv: How our fathers went down into Egypt, and we have dwelt in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians vexed us, and our fathers:
verses.ct: Our ancestors went down to Egypt, and we lived there for a long time. The Egyptians mistreated us and our ancestors.

verses.kjv: And when we cried unto the LORD, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and hath brought us forth out of Egypt: and, behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of thy border:
verses.ct: When we cried out to the LORD, he heard us and sent an angel who brought us out of Egypt. Now here we are in Kadesh, a town right on the edge of your territory.

verses.kjv: Let us pass, I pray thee, through thy country: we will not pass through the fields, or through the vineyards, neither will we drink of the water of the wells: we will go by the king’s high way, we will not turn to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed thy borders.
verses.ct: Please let us travel through your country. We won't go through any fields or vineyards, and we won't drink water from any wells. We'll stay on the main road and won't turn right or left until we've passed through your territory."

verses.kjv: And Edom said unto him, Thou shalt not pass by me, lest I come out against thee with the sword.
verses.ct: But Edom replied, "You may not pass through here. If you try, I will march out and attack you with an army."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel said unto him, We will go by the high way: and if I and my cattle drink of thy water, then I will pay for it: I will only, without doing anything else, go through on my feet.
verses.ct: The Israelites responded, "We'll stick to the main road, and if we or our livestock drink any of your water, we'll pay for it. We're only asking to pass through on foot — nothing more."

verses.kjv: And he said, Thou shalt not go through. And Edom came out against him with much people, and with a strong hand.
verses.ct: But Edom said, "You may not pass through." Then Edom marched out against them with a large and powerful force.

verses.kjv: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border: wherefore Israel turned away from him.
verses.ct: Since Edom refused to let Israel pass through their territory, Israel turned and went another way.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh, and came unto mount Hor.
verses.ct: The entire Israelite community traveled from Kadesh and arrived at Mount Hor.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron in mount Hor, by the coast of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.ct: At Mount Hor, near the border of Edom, the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,

verses.kjv: Aaron shall be gathered unto his people: for he shall not enter into the land which I have given unto the children of Israel, because ye rebelled against my word at the water of Meribah.
verses.ct: "Aaron is about to join his ancestors. He will not enter the land I have given to the Israelites, because both of you defied my instructions at the waters of Meribah.

verses.kjv: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up unto mount Hor:
verses.ct: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up Mount Hor.

verses.kjv: And strip Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son: and Aaron shall be gathered unto his people, and shall die there.
verses.ct: Remove Aaron's priestly garments and put them on his son Eleazar. Aaron will join his ancestors and die there."

verses.kjv: And Moses did as the LORD commanded: and they went up into mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
verses.ct: Moses did what the LORD commanded. They climbed Mount Hor as the entire community watched.

verses.kjv: And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount.
verses.ct: Moses removed Aaron's garments and put them on his son Eleazar. Aaron died there on top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came back down.

verses.kjv: And when all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they mourned for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
verses.ct: When the entire community realized that Aaron had died, all of Israel mourned for him for 30 days.
